item.title: Monitor MongoDB using Builtin Prometheus Discovery
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. Monitoring MongoDB with builtin Prometheus This tutorial will show you how to monitor MongoDB database using builtin Prometheus scrapper. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster. If you do not already have a cluster, you can create one by using Minikube. Install KubeDB operator in your cluster following the steps here.

item.title: Monitor MongoDB using Coreos Prometheus Operator
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. Monitoring MongoDB Using CoreOS Prometheus Operator CoreOS prometheus-operator provides simple and Kubernetes native way to deploy and configure Prometheus server. This tutorial will show you how to use CoreOS Prometheus operator to monitor MongoDB database deployed with KubeDB. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster.
